author: Special Correspondent
text:
A day after 29 fishermen from the State were arrested by the Sri Lankan Navy, Chief Minister Jayalalithaa on Monday wrote to Prime Minister Narendra Modi seeking to secure the release of all fishermen and their boats.

In her letter, Ms. Jayalalithaa said that the livelihood of the fishermen, who were fishing in the traditional waters of the Palk Bay was being “continuously infringed upon by the Sri Lankan Navy’s recurrent actions of apprehension, attack and harassment of the innocent fishermen.” She reiterated the position of the State government that a permanent solution to this issue was “possible only by restoring India’s sovereignty over Katchatheevu” and urged that proactive action needed to be initiated at the highest level to ensure a permanent solution to this issue. Ms. Jayalalithaa urged the personal intervention of Mr. Modi to issue specific directions to the Ministry of External Affairs to take up the matter with Sri Lankan authorities and to secure the immediate release of these fishermen and their boats.

In two separate incidents on March 6, a total of 29 fishermen from Rameswaram and Thoothukudi districts were apprehended by the Sri Lankan Navy. Presently, a total of 64 fishermen re in Sri Lankan custody.

Narendra Modi
title: ‘Secure release of fishermen in Sri Lankan custody’
